Talon:

Talon hug tighly eher babies while ther silver baby dragon snarled =
and bite the air in the challing way while the black one hide inside her mo=
ms arms. Talon looked at Tucson as she implored him not left her alone.

--=
- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>
> Tuc=
son still remains stiff and rigid.  Tail thrashing the ground as he continu=
es to listen to the old dragons air of caution.
> 
> " Then you shall step =
no further.  I will meet with Archane but he is not to lay harm on my child=
ren or my wife.  He meets with me outside the cave and nowhere within it.  =
Violate my demands and there will be consequences.  I do not trust you or a=
ny stranger who assumes they can just drop in unannounced.  The old dragon =
was wise not to trust you.  Something about you makes me rather unsettled. =
 Now go, give him that message and bother me no more until I ask for you."
=
> 
> He recedes back into the cave, with a growl of warning.  Immediately, =
he rejoins Talon and his babies, reassuring them all with gentile snout rub=
s to all of them.  Again he could not help but cradle his offspring in his =
front paws, and give them both a gentile kiss on the head.  He then keeps a=
n eye at the foot of the cave.  He keeps his word as parental instincts kic=
k in.

okery." DISCIPLE said.

ing would cast his
